stages.title: Define Your Law & Political Science Vision
stages.description: Clarify your interests in law, political science, public policy, or international relations, and identify target universities.

Global.overview: Top law and political science programs value strong analytical skills, debate experience, and clear specialization interests.
checklist: Research 5-7 top programs (Harvard, Oxford, Cambridge, LSE, NUS)
Identify your interest (law, political science, public policy, international relations)
Assess your debate, writing, and analytical preparation
Create a 3-year roadmap connecting experiences, academics, and applications

US.overview: US programs emphasize strong academics, debate, writing, and leadership experience.
checklist: Research reach, target, and safety schools
Plan your Common App personal statement theme
Identify debate, Model UN, or political activities

UK.overview: UK programs prioritize A-levels, LNAT/TSA, and strong personal statements.
checklist: Review entry requirements for Oxford, Cambridge, LSE
Start LNAT (for law) or TSA preparation (Year 12)
Research UK law/political science program structures

Asia.overview: Bridge national curricula with global standards.
checklist: Review law/political science topics in national exams
Identify debate or Model UN opportunities

quiz.q: Which test is important for UK law admissions?
What do top law/political science programs value most?

stages.title: Build Debate, Writing & Leadership Skills
stages.description: Develop argumentation, writing, and leadership skills through debate, Model UN, or political activities.

Global.overview: Demonstrate law/political science ability through debate, writing, and leadership experiences.
checklist: Join debate team, Model UN, or mock trial
Write opinion pieces or articles on current events
Participate in political clubs or student government
Document your debate and writing achievements
projectIdeas: Start a debate club or Model UN chapter
Write articles for school newspaper on political topics

US.overview: Link experiences to competitions and applications.

UK.overview: Integrate experiences into EPQ or UCAS.
checklist: Draft EPQ proposal on law/political topic
Link debate experiences to university themes
Participate in debate or Model UN
Work with mentor on political project

quiz.q: What's the best way to demonstrate law/political science skills?

stages.title: Strengthen Academic Foundation
stages.description: Excel in history, English, and analytical coursework.

Global.overview: Strong reading, writing, and analytical preparation is essential.
checklist: Master critical reading and analytical writing
Study history, politics, and current events
Read legal cases or political theory
Maintain strong grades in humanities and social sciences
Complete AP US History, Government, or English
Read current events and political news
Achieve A* in A-level History or English

quiz.q: What academic areas are most critical for law/political science?
opts: Reading, writing, analytical thinking, and current events knowledge
quiz.correct: Reading, writing, analytical thinking, and current events knowledge

stages.title: Craft Your Law/Political Science Narrative
stages.description: Translate your debate, writing, and achievements into compelling applications.

Global.overview: Connect your law/political science passion and achievements.
checklist: Highlight debate, writing, and leadership experiences
Connect to solving legal or political problems
Get feedback from teachers or mentors
Draft Common App essay with law/political focus
Prepare statements for UCAS and Common App
Draft reflection on law/political career goals

quiz.q: What should your law/political science statement highlight?
opts: Analytical thinking, debate/writing skills, and commitment to justice/policy
quiz.correct: Analytical thinking, debate/writing skills, and commitment to justice/policy

stages.title: Final Preparation & Interviews
stages.description: Polish applications and prepare for interviews.

checklist: Prepare to discuss arguments and current events

quiz.q: What's key for law/political science interviews?
opts: Clear argumentation, knowledge of current events, and analytical thinking
quiz.correct: Clear argumentation, knowledge of current events, and analytical thinking
